author: @Metropoles
title: Alvo de den√∫ncias por abuso, igreja Bola de Neve atra√≠a famosos; veja | Metr√≥poles
text: Alvo de den√∫ncias por abuso, igreja Bola de Neve atra√≠a famosos; veja Rodolfo Abtantes, ex-raimundos, usou as redes sociais para acusar a igreja Bola de Neve de Balne√°rio Cambori√∫ de abuso atualizado Compartilhar not√≠cia As den√∫ncias de supostos [ desvios de verbas na igreja Bola de Neve de Balne√°rio Cambori√∫](https://www.metropoles.com/colunas/fabia-oliveira/sistema-podre-dispara-esposa-de-ex-raimundos-sobre-bola-de-neve) come√ßaram a pipocar nas redes sociais e, com isso, muitos ex-frequentadores resolveram se manifestar. [Rodolfo Abrantes](https://www.instagram.com/orodolfoabrantes/), ex-integrante dos Raimundos, e sua mulher, [Alexandra Abrantes](https://www.instagram.com/alexandra_abrantes_/), denunciaram abusos que sofreram no local, frequentado por diversas celebridades. A congrega√ß√£o √© famosa no meio das celebridades e j√° foi queridinha de diversos famosos. Um dos membros da congrega√ß√£o era Jo√£o Figueiredo, marido de Sasha. O artista √© filho de pastores da Igreja Bola de Neve, os l√≠deres Eli Figueiredo e L√∫ Figueiredo. Ele n√£o faz mais parte da igreja e tamb√©m deixou a carreira gospel para se dedicar ao pop. Quem tamb√©m j√° frequentou a igreja foi a atriz Fernanda Vasconcellos, na unidade da Barra da Tijuca, no Rio de Janeiro. A atriz Giselle Policarpo, que atualmente est√° afastada da televis√£o, √© pastora da Bola de Neve h√° quatro anos em Niter√≥i. Ela p√¥de ser vista atuando no ano passado na reprise de Mulheres Apaixonadas, gravada em 2003, que foi reexibida no Vale a pena ver de novo da TV Globo. Monique Evans tamb√©m j√° frequentou a igreja. √Ä √©poca, ela apresentava um programa er√≥tico na Rede TV, e anunciou na igreja que estava deixando o quadro. Entenda a pol√™mica Rodolfo Abrantes, que fez parte da banda Raimundos at√© 2001 e hoje √© pastor, soltou o verbo no Instagram, na noite de quarta-feira (22/5), e afirmou ter sofrido abusos psicol√≥gicos no minist√©rio, de onde saiu em 2011. ‚ÄúN√£o cabe a mim julgar a√ß√µes e atitudes de gente que n√£o me diz respeito porque eu e minha esposa nos desligamos desse minist√©rio em 2011. Escolhi n√£o falar nada naquela √©poca com a preocupa√ß√£o de n√£o arrastar pessoas para fora de igreja e de n√£o ser acusado de mais coisas do que eu fui‚Äù, come√ßou ele. E continuou relatando: ‚ÄúIsso n√£o foi rec√≠proco. Eu e minha esposa fomos taxados de irrespons√°veis, minha esposa foi chamada de Jezabel, eu fui chamado at√© de caloteiro. Me acusaram de ter uma d√≠vida com o selo Bola Music, o que, no final de 2022, foi feita uma presta√ß√£o de contas e eu n√£o devia absolutamente nada‚Äù, garantiu. Em seguida, Rodolfo Abrantes afirmou que n√£o entraria no m√©rito das den√∫ncias de verbas: ‚ÄúMas o que eu quero dizer n√£o se refere √†s acusa√ß√µes que t√™m vindo √† tona, quest√µes envolvendo fraudes e outras coisas que n√£o me dizem respeito e eu n√£o tenho conhecimento, prova, nem base nem capacidade pra ficar acusando ningu√©m‚Äù, disse, antes de completar: ‚ÄúO que estou aqui pra dizer √© que estou com a minha esposa, vi o sofrimento dela, vi o quanto ela sofreu de abusos emocionais naquele minist√©rio. N√≥s sofremos demais como fam√≠lia, nosso casamento foi abalado naquela √©poca e n√≥s sobrevivemos. Estamos firmes, mas carregamos cicatrizes de feridas que demoram muito pra curar‚Äù, definiu.

author: MENAFN
title: President Awards 152 Ukrainian Defenders, 80 Of Them Posthumously | MENAFN.COM
text:
( MENAFN - UkrinForm) President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelensky has honored 152 defenders of Ukraine with state awards, including 80 posthumously.
The corresponding decrees as of January 18 were published on the president's website, Ukrinform reports.
According to the decrees, the awards were given "for personal courage shown in the defense of Ukraine's state sovereignty and territorial integrity, selfless performance of military duty."
Read also: Zelensky, Sunak visit wounded Ukrainian defenders at Kyiv hospital The defenders were awarded the Orders of Bohdan Khmelnytskyi and Danylo Halytskyi, the Order for Courage, as well as the medals "For Military Service to Ukraine," "Defender of the Fatherland‚Äù and‚ÄúFor the Saved Life‚Äù.
As Ukrinform reported, on January 8, President Volodymyr Zelensky awarded another 193 defenders of Ukraine with state awards, 124 of them posthumously.

author: √öltimas Noticias
title: Nuevo caso de intoxicaci√≥n deja 37 afectados en Sucre
text:
Un nuevo caso de 37 personas intoxicadas se present√≥ en la Unidad Educativa Juan Pablo P√©rez Alfonzo y en la escuela Luis Jos√© Esp√≠n de la comunidad El Tacal, parroquia Ayacucho. municipio Sucre, estado Sucre.
El hecho sucedi√≥ la ma√±ana de este jueves 20 de febrero. Dificultad para respirar, taquicardia, n√°useas, v√≥mitos, debilidad, baja presi√≥n arterial y desmayos son algunos de los s√≠ntomas de presunta intoxicaci√≥n que presentaron.
Las personas percibieron un fuerte olor en el ambiente, el cual gener√≥ los s√≠ntomas que obligaron a trasladar a 20 adolescentes y 12 adultos al centro de salud de Fe y Alegr√≠a; 3 adolescente y un adulto al CDI Cumanagoto y un adolescente al Hospital de Veteranos Dr. Julio Rodr√≠gue, seg√∫n reporte de la Secretar√≠a Ejecutiva de Prevenci√≥n y Seguridad Ciudadana de la entidad oriental.
Actualmente realizan las pruebas pertinentes que determinar√°n las causas que generaron los s√≠ntomas en los estudiantes y personal del plantel.
9 planteles afectados Con estos nuevos casos que se registraron este jueves, el estado Sucre suma cerca de nueve (9) planteles educativos donde se han suscitado estos eventos que generan angustia y preocupaci√≥n en padres y representantes, quienes exigen a las autoridades competentes se pronuncien y den con las causas que generan esta situaci√≥n que pone en riesgo la salud y la vida de la poblaci√≥n estudiantil.
‚ÄúVan a tomar cartas en el asunto despu√©s que haya una tragedia en los liceos‚Äù, se√±al√≥ la representante de uno de los estudiantes afectados.
El d√≠a martes 18 de febrero ocurri√≥ una eventualidad de presunta intoxicaci√≥n en el Liceo Bolivariano ‚ÄúJos√© Antonio Lemus P√©rez‚Äù, donde nueve personas entre estudiantes y personal docente resultaron afectados, la situaci√≥n se repiti√≥ en la Escuela ‚ÄúFrancisco Aristigueta Badaraco‚Äù, ambas instituciones ubicadas en Cuman√°.
Van m√°s de 50 afectados En las √∫ltimas dos semanas, m√°s de 50 personas entre estudiantes, obreros y profesores han sido ingresados en centros asistenciales del estado Sucre, presentando estos s√≠ntomas.
De acuerdo a fuentes de seguridad y salud, a√∫n se desconocen los motivos que producen est√°s sintomatolog√≠as, alegan que de acuerdo a las pruebas toxicol√≥gicas realizadas en los menores no se arrojan se√±ales de ninguna sustancia.
Trujillo monitorea Las autoridades de salud del estado Trujillo esperan los resultados de las muestras tomadas a los 12 estudiantes y tres adultos que resultaron afectados por una presunta intoxicaci√≥n por sustancia desconocida el pasado lunes en el Complejo Educativo Juan Germ√°n Roscio, ubicado en la parroquia Mercedes D√≠az del municipio Valera.
El Cuerpo de Investigaciones Cient√≠ficas, Penales y Criminal√≠sticas (Cicpc) y los entes de seguridad y prevenci√≥n a√∫n mantienen las averiguaciones respecto al caso.
La subdirectora del Hospital Universitario Pedro Emilio Carrillo de la ciudad de Valera, Carmen Berrios, inform√≥ que los estudiantes y adultos afectados cumplieron tratamiento m√©dico, fueron estabilizados y egresados.
Van 40 alumnos y cuatro adultos afectados por presunta intoxicaci√≥n por sustancia desconocida en un colegio de la ciudad de Valera. Foto: archivo @fundasaludtru Plan de resguardo El estado Monagas activ√≥ el Plan ‚ÄúM√°s Formaci√≥n, Mayor Protecci√≥n‚Äù en las instituciones educativas de la entidad para la prevenci√≥n sobre el uso correcto de las plataformas digitales, inform√≥, la presidenta de la Fundaci√≥n Regional Ni√±o Sim√≥n, Sorenelly Zambrano de Luna.
La tambi√©n primera dama del estado manifest√≥ que la actividad de formaci√≥n y acompa√±amiento, va dirigida al personal docente y estudiantes, y corresponde a una primera fase de acci√≥n, resaltando como premisa que ‚Äúel respeto no tiene g√©nero, es un derecho de todas y todos‚Äù.
La presidenta de la Fundaci√≥n Regional Ni√±o Sim√≥n detall√≥ que la actividad se desarroll√≥ en el Complejo Educativo ‚ÄúFrancisco Isnardi‚Äù y de manera simult√°nea en 10 instituciones educativas de los municipios Ezequiel Zamora, Uracoa, Cede√±o y Sotillo.
Indic√≥ que estas acciones buscan sensibilizar y generar un aspecto de ‚Äúapadrinaje‚Äù para que desde los organismos involucrados unifiquen, determinen y permitan detectar cualquier situaci√≥n irregular en centros educativos.
Presidenta del Estado Mayor de Protecci√≥n Infantil en Monagas, Sorenelly Zambrano de Luna, dirige el plan ‚ÄúM√°s formaci√≥n, m√°s protecci√≥n‚Äù. Foto: Jos√© P√©rez Incluir√°n el acoso escolar en la Reforma Constitucional ‚ÄúEl tema del acoso escolar no puede banalizarse como ha ocurrido en algunos planteles, donde un grupo de j√≥venes cometen este tipo de actos, y la acci√≥n negativa la conocen las autoridades del plantel y no hacen nada hasta que se viraliza en redes sociales‚Äù, as√≠ lo afirm√≥ el Fiscal General de la Rep√∫blica, Tarek William Saab, durante su participaci√≥n en el foro Acoso Escolar y Retos Virales.
Destac√≥ que si el acoso escolar como delito o falta no est√° previsto en la ley, ‚Äúahora con la reforma constitucional, pensando en la defensa del ni√±o, ni√±a y adolescente, habr√° que incluirlo para legislar de manera precisa‚Äù.
Durante su intervenci√≥n, el Fiscal General indic√≥ que desde el Ministerio P√∫blico se present√≥ ante la Asamblea Nacional un proyecto para que la violencia entre adolescentes no sea ‚Äúnormalizada‚Äù.
Fiscal Tarek William Saab junto a la presidenta del Tribunal Supremo, Caryslia Rodr√≠guez. Foto: Prensa Ministerio P√∫blico

title: ‚ÄúYou Don‚Äôt Have Nothing Nice to Say‚Äù: 15‚Äì0, Heavyweight Boxing Prospect Jared Anderson Slams Boxing Matchmaker for Making Controversial Comment on Gervonta Davis Converting to Islam - EssentiallySports
text:
Gervonta Davis and his legal history. Davis, who just turned Muslim, has been in and out of legal troubles for a long time, and Rick Glaser , the boxing matchmaker was quick to point that out.
America‚Äôs Favorite Video Today
But Davis wasn‚Äôt left alone, the 15-0 prospect Jared Anderson came to his rescue. He quickly shut down Rick‚Äôs tweet with a jab of his own. What exact words did Rick and Jared exchange?
Jared helps Gervonta Davis escape from criticism ADVERTISEMENT

Gervonta Davis , renowned for his prowess in the boxing ring, recently embarked on a transformative personal journey, embracing Islam. His new identity as Abdul Wahid , meaning ‚Äúthe servant of the one,‚Äù marks a significant shift in his life. This transition, however, unexpectedly found itself under the social media microscope, thanks to Rick Glaser , a well-known boxing matchmaker. Glaser tweeted, ‚ÄúThe fighter that will now be known as Abdul Wahid. Hopefully now that he found religion he‚Äôll stay out of trouble. #Boxing.‚Äù This remark comes on the backdrop of his legal troubles. Davis has been involved in them since November 2022 , when he pled guilty to four traffic offenses.

Amid this, the undefeated heavyweight Jared Anderson came to defend him. Anderson, known for his strength in the ring, demonstrated equal force in his words. ‚ÄúThis mf weird asf yo mama ain‚Äôt never told you if you don‚Äôt have nothing nice to say don‚Äôt say shit at all,‚Äù he responded to Glaser‚Äôs tweet, ‚Äúhopefully he‚Äôll stay out of trouble‚Äù wtf.‚Äù Anderson‚Äôs defense of Davis‚Äô decision demonstrates not only his solidarity, but also a deeper understanding of respecting personal and religious decisions.

author: CHRIS SPARGO
title: Teacher Who Strangled Ashley Reeves, 17, Dragged Her Into Woods and Left Her to Die Over Affair Out of Prison
text: Samson Shelton told investigators that he and Ashley Reeves had a sexual relationship at the time, saying:"I will say this: we never kissed. We never kissed. Yes, we did have sex in the back of the vehicle, and after that day I felt absolutely terrible." An [Illinois](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/illinois) high school [teacher](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/teachers) who left one of his students to die in the woods is now a free man. Sam Shelton, 44, was released from the Illinois Correctional Center on Monday, 17 years after he pled guilty to attempted [murder](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/murder). His victim, 17-year-old Ashley Reeves, somehow managed to survive not only the barrage of attempts that Shelton said he made to end her life but also the over 30 hours she spent alone in the woods after the attack. Shelton told investigators that he killed Reeves; police thought she was dead when they discovered her body; paramedics said Reeves would not make it out of the woods alive, and doctors put her in a medically induced coma after she arrived at the hospital. Reeves somehow defied all odds and did survive, then slowly relearned how to speak and move her body over the next year. Shelton meanwhile went on to serve 20 years in prison, and on Monday, April 22, he walked free three years before completing the full sentence, with the board granting him the earliest possible release allowed by law in his case. Ashley Reeves Missing Reeves told her parents that she had a job interview on the afternoon of April 27, 2006, and driving her boyfriend's car, she left home and headed for a neighboring town, her boyfriend, Jeremy Smith, told investigators while being questioned by police the day after Reeves' disappearance. Her parents reached out to the St. Clair County Sheriff's Office hours after Reeves left, reporting that she had not returned home and was not answering calls and texts from friends, according to investigators. Concern grew tenfold when authorities discovered Smith's abandoned car with the outfit Reeves planned to wear on her interview and the workout gear she planned to change into after the interview so she could go play basketball with friends. Investigators said the clothing had not been worn. Soon, Reeves' friends and family were being called in to answer questions about the missing girl's final days and whom she had been spending time with, according to investigators. Back at home, Reeves' mother started calling numbers from her daughter's phone bill in an attempt to get any information on her daughter, according to investigators, Michelle Reeves noticed that her daughter called one number more than most of the others and reaches out to that person ‚Äî Shelton. Investigators say that Shelton tells Reeves' mother he has no idea where she might be and then goes back to dancing at a local club. Things start to come into focus when friends of Reeves tell investigators that she had been seeing an older man and planned to meet him on the night she went missing, according to investigators. That is enough for detectives to call in Shelton for questioning. Sam Shelton Confession Shelton appears cool and collected as he arrives at the sheriff's office after coaching high school baseball practice on April 28, 2006. Over the course of the next 12 hours, he is seen changing his story and eventually confessing to murder but never losing his cool in footage obtained by Inside Edition Digital. He starts off by telling investigators that Reeves is a persistent young woman who had long been pursuing him and making constant calls. Then, he admits to having an inappropriate relationship with the student, saying: "I will say this: we never kissed. We never kissed. Yes, we did have sex in the back of the vehicle, and after that day I felt absolutely terrible about that." A few hours later, Shelton says that he and Reeves were together on the day she disappeared and that there had been an incident, but swears he did not do anything to hurt the teenager. "She was screaming and kicking and everything. So I got her [out of the car], shut the door, ran the car, I took off. I left her," said Shelton. "I left her there is what I did. I left her out there ... I left her right out there." Finally, after a few more hours, Shelton tells investigators what really happened the previous day. Shelton says that he put Reeves in a wrestling chokehold that caused her to stop breathing and that he feared he had killed the young woman. So, Shelton says he decided to drag her into the woods at a local park to die. "I dragged her to a wooded area, I tied this thing around her neck to make it look like someone choked her out there," Shelton tells investigators. "I was a nervous wreck, thinking, 'What do I do? What do I do? I wanted to make it look like she had gotten, she got strangled there in the woods," he says. Shelton says that he then took a belt and repeatedly strangled Reeves, pulling so tight that he broke the belt at one point. "All of a sudden I heard like a gurgle. And when I heard the gurgle, I let go. And when I let go, she had like spit, foam, coming out of her mouth. And then I had seen that she was the sickest color I had ever seen," Shelton says. He then fled like a "bat out of hell" he says, and left the scene. Shelton then tells investigators he will take them to where he left Reeves. Ashley Reeves Alive It takes over 39 minutes of searching in the dark and rain for police to find Reeves, who they assume is dead. Then, they see the young girl breathe. She is rushed to the hospital and put in a medically induced coma while Shelton returns to the sheriff's office and shares his concerns. "Am I gonna be able to get like, my contact solution, and take my contacts out? And my toothbrush?" Shelton asks at one point, expressing his disbelief when he is told he will not get those things. Later he says: "Am I gonna get like, a little private toilet? Because I can't pee when there is people around because of my urinary stress disorder," Shelton says in the recording. The man who left a teenager alone in the woods to die for 30 hours after a brutal attack tells investigators: "Because I'll be miserable if I can't pee." The case does not go to [ trial](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/trial) because Shelton agrees to enter a guilty plea to a charge of attempted murder. Reeves is still recovering when he is sentenced so she fif not speak in court during the sentencing. It would be years before Reeves finally broke her silence, first with the release of her memoir "Left for Dead" and then by appearing on Crime Watch Daily in an interview with [Elizabeth Smart](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/elizabeth-smart). In that interview, Reeves said that she still cannot recall what happened in the days leading up to and after the attack. Reeves also told Smart that she does not want to remember that night. "Part of me wants to try and remember, and then part of me is like 'Oh, that might not be a good idea,'" Reeves said in that interview. She also said that she had to learn how to eat and drink "They had to retrain me how to eat and how to drink," said Ashley. "But I remember my first drink of water, and it was amazing." Four years after that interview, a production company adapted Reeves' memoir for the small screen. "Left for Dead: The Ashley Reeves Story" aired on Lifetime in 2021 and starred "Beverly Hills 90210" alum Jennie Garth as Ashley Reeves' mother Michelle Reeves. Inside Edition Digital reached out to the Reeves family, but she did not respond to a request for comment. Shelton and his lawyer also did not respond to requests for comment. Shelton will be on [ parole](https://www.insideedition.com/tag/parole) for the next three years and is banned from having any contact with Reeves.

author: Kim Kavin
title: Octoport‚Äôs Carbon-Fiber Yacht Furniture Elevates Life Onboard
text:
Arun Maheswaran is excited. This past September, he displayed his
Octoport outdoor yacht furniture for the first time at the Monaco Yacht Show, advancing the dream he‚Äôs been working to achieve since he started the company in 2017. From his showroom near the L√ºrssen shipyard in Bremen, Germany, he brought chairs like the one above, which is part of his new Oyoso collection. He also displayed folding chairs that can be taken to the beach, and bar stools from his bespoke collection‚Äîall of it lightweight and in styles and colors possible to create because of Octoport‚Äôs carbon-fiber construction.
‚ÄúThe feedback was really, really good,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúA lot of owners and owners‚Äô reps, also designers, they said it was the first time they were seeing furniture like that.‚Äù
The way the seat appears to float above the base is a signature element of his designs. Each piece is painted similar to the way a carbon-fiber yacht hull is painted, with hundreds of available colors (as well as custom ones). ‚ÄúThis kind of design will not work with teak or steel,‚Äù he says. ‚ÄúIt would be really heavy, or there would be joint creaks after some years.‚Äù
All the crew needs to do is clean the furniture the same way they clean a carbon-fiber hull, and it should last for 10 to 20 years, he says. The carbon-fiber material helps to keep the yacht‚Äôs weight down, and allows styles like the folding chairs to be more compact for stowing and transporting in a tender that‚Äôs headed off to the beach.
Yacht owners are starting to place large orders, Maheswaran says, with one refit happening in Greece that will include a substantial amount of Octoport furniture on board. An American owner bought several of the folding chairs at the Monaco show, at a price point of at least $5,400 apiece.
Pricing is made to order, like the furniture itself, with fabric and color selections affecting the final tally. Quantity also matters, he says: ‚ÄúWe can go cheaper if the owner wants 20 of these chairs.‚Äù
Maheswaran adds that he is delighted to see yacht owners and designers opening their minds to the possibilities: ‚ÄúI want to bring this freshness to the industry.‚Äù

author: Hearing At Home LLC
title: Nano OTC Nearly Invisible CIC Hearing Aids Get Most 5-Star Verified Reviews
text: Nano OTC Nearly Invisible CIC Hearing Aids Get Most 5-Star Verified Reviews Over 5,000 real shoppers have given Nano Hearing Aids‚Äô (888-310-6266) over-the-counter (OTC) hearing aids a five-star rating. Try a pair today to see why they are the best and most affordable choice for perceived mild to moderate hearing loss. (firmenpresse) - Do you find yourself having to ask people to repeat themselves more often? Are you always using closed captions when watching TV? Or maybe your spouse is always telling you that you have the volume up way too loud? If you suspect you may be in the early stages of hearing loss and you‚Äôre looking for a quick, easy, and affordable solution, you should consider Nano Hearing Aids. Find out more about their OTC hearing aids and shop their range at https://nanohearingaids.com/pages/all-reviews Find The Right Hearing Aids For YouThe team at Nano Hearing Aids appreciates that, if you are buying your first hearing aid, it can be difficult to distinguish between different models and styles‚Äîlike completely-in-canal (CIC) or behind-the-ear (BTE) aids‚Äîwhich is why they are pleased to be providing your with guidance to their available designs. Nano believes it is also important to bring you the verified words of real shoppers who have been using their devices, so that you can find out more about their fit, features, functionality, and more. That‚Äôs why their team is pleased to make over 6,000 comprehensive customer reviews available to you. Shop Comfortable, Rechargeable & Nearly Invisible AidsNano Hearing Aids has a selection of different OTC hearing aids available, which they believe may be suitable for you if you are over the age of 18 and you have perceived mild to moderate hearing loss. Their popular base model, the NANO CIC Recharge OTC Hearing Aids (CIC2), which starts from USD$297.00, has a comfortable and nearly invisible CIC design.
